chapter.title: User Management
chapter.para: Knowledge has an adminsitrator role that can craete new user accounts, assign roles, and deactive users. The folling sections describes these functions .

section.title: Adding New User
section.para: To add a new user, select "View Users" option under the username, which in this case is "admin" in the upper right hand corner, .
A page will display that lists all the user accounts in Knowledge, refer to figure XXX. Select the "New Account" button on this page to create a new user account, refer to Figure XXX.

On the Create a New Account page, fill in the following information:
Display Name – the name that will be displayed in the upper right corner of the web-pages
User Name – this field is optional but can be used to login
E-mail – is the email address associated with the user account
Password – entering a password is optional
role – select the role(s) for this user
Select Create Account when you are done to create the new account.

section.title: Modifying User Roles
section.para: An administrator can modify a user's role by selecting View Users and then selecting Edit. This will bring you to the Edit Account Profile for the user where you can add or remove roles for the user (a user can have more than one role). When done modifying a user's role(s) select Save to change the user's permission(s) or select Cancel to cancel the modifications made or return to the previous page.

section.title: Disable a User Account
section.para: The Administrator can also disable a user's account by selecting View Users and then selecting Edit. This will bring you to the Edit Account Profile where the Disable Account is selected. This will prevent a the user from using their credentials to login to Knowledge. Then select Save or select Cancel to cancel the modifications made or to return to the previous page.

section.title: Return to Knowledge Homepage
section.para: To return to the Knowledge homepage from View Users go to username, which in this case is "admin" in the upper right hand corner and select Home.
